Dating: 22ND DYNASTY (not before); 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD; 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Anepigraphic canopic jar of Amset
Description: Canopic jar of Amset, with a human head as lid, discovered in Herakleopolis Magna, in the Third Intermediate Period cemetery, together with the three other partner vases. It has no inscription, and it was found without the deceased's viscera inside, a common feature of this period. It comes from Djedptahiuesankh's tomb.
